intro: Discolobium hirtum, commonly known as the hairy discolobium, is a shrub native to Australia. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its compound leaves and flowering habits. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid regions, adapting to harsh environmental conditions. Its hairy stems and leaves provide a degree of drought resistance. Discolobium hirtum is often found in rocky soils and is a component of native flora in its natural habitat.
